  3. Concepts

    Software development approaches

    1. Agile Development: iterative, incremental and evolutionary; short and frequent feedback loop; welcome changing requirements
      1st iteration(a few functions -> testing) ->
      2nd iteration(more functions -> testing) ->
      ... ->
      nth iteration(all functions -> testing)
      Each iteration is a sprint.
      More fine grained
    2. Waterfall model: development done -> testing

    Software testing

    1. Static testing: read code (verification)
    2. Dynamic testing: run code with testcases (validation). Testing level:
      1). unit testing: (done with unit test framework) Unit testing refers to tests that verify the functionality of a specific section of code, usually at the function level. In an object-oriented environment, this is usually at the class level, and the minimal unit tests include the constructors and destructors.
      2). integration testing: verify the interfaces between components by combining them.
      3). system testing: verify that the system meets its requirements. e.g. people test a website by playing with it according to a testing plan.

  4. References
